It was a grant that was to endure only until the King should give William an equivalent amount oi land, to wit, twenty librates. William died leaving an iniant heir, and the King proceeded to act as though he, as guardian in ehivalry, could deal with this rent os 2620 during the heir’s minority. Her claim was successful, and the Prior was ordered to pay the 520 to her.
